name: Bertrand Badré
text: We have set these massively challenging Millennium Development Goals and Sustainable Development Goals. We need 2.5 trillion per year to achieve them, which will require innovative financing. That's what @BertrandBadre's book is about. - @OfficeGSBrown

name: Bertrand Badré
text: .@BertrandBadre It's very interesting to have this conversation tonight with what's going on in the market. I don't think we're on the verge of a collapse, but we haven't prepared for the next major threat. #LSEfinance

name: Bertrand Badré
text: .@BertrandBadre: It's very interesting to have this event tonight after market's fall today. It's a wake-up call. We averted worse in 2008-2010. We quietened fire, but we've not prepared a new system. Did we address issues? #LSEfinance

name: Bertrand Badré
text: .@BertrandBadre: Have we really committed enough money to reform roadmap? Green Bonds & Social Impact Bonds for example, booming markets but a drop in the ocean of global bond trading. #LSEfinance

name: Bertrand Badré
text: We have patched the system and avoided the worst, but we don't yet know where we're going. -@BertrandBadre #LSEfinance

name: Bertrand Badré
text: .@BertrandBadre: People are excited about #GreenBonds and #SocialImpactBonds. These are great instruments, but they are only a drop in the bucket. #LSEfinance//t.co/EuWEYtqhpn

name: Bertrand Badré
text: .@BertrandBadre: People are excited about #GreenBonds and #SocialImpactBonds. These are great instruments, but they are only a drop in the bucket. #LSEfinance//t.co/EuWEYtqhpn

name: Bertrand Badré
text: .@SSyfussArnaud: How can we restore ordinary people's trust in finance? @BertrandBadre: Must acknowledge we've lost trust. For example, in France in summer 08 discussion was on 1billion for poor. Raising 420bn quickly for relief broke trust. #LSEfinance

name: Bertrand Badré
text: We need to build trust in the finance system by making sure that we are not just writing goals on a piece of paper but we are actually following through and showing the people - @BertrandBadre @LSEpublicevents @lseideas #LSEfinance

name: Bertrand Badré
text: @BertrandBadre: We need to rebuild trust in the system by making sure the commitments we make are serious, by making sure that the financial system is built on accountability and simplicity. #LSEfinance

name: Bertrand Badré
text: .@BertrandBadre We've never had a larger financial system then we've had today. That's opportunity as well as risk, huge potential scale. How to end mis-allocation of world capital, & put it into global development? #LSEfinance

name: Bertrand Badré
text: .@BertrandBadre: We have a massive mis-allocation of capital at a global level. We have to build a system what will put money where it needs to go.//t.co/AdvD4aCKdx

name: Bertrand Badré
text: .@BertrandBadre: As well as infrastructure, Global finance for local banks can be crucial for community development. But we must break bias against complexity & towards safe large country bonds. #LSEfinance

name: Bertrand Badré
text: Can finance save the world? Discuss! @BertrandBadre @OfficeGSBrown @SSyfussArnaud #LSEFinance @lseideas//t.co/NkEkSA0tN2

name: Bertrand Badré
text: Can finance save the world? @BertrandBadre says yes, the question is how do you move from finance contributing billions to development to trillions?//t.co/Be1Vhb3ttl

name: Bertrand Badré
text: .@BertrandBadre How do we get from the billions to the trillions? (I pay tribute to UK, only G7 country at 0.7% spending on aid.) Through local tax regimes yes, but also by utilising our savings & pensions globally to invest. #LSEfinance

name: Bertrand Badré
text: It's crucial to fix the financial system (find innovative ways) to make it the servant instead of the master, so that our money -pensions/savings- finance our values/needs.#LSEFinance @GordonBrown___ @BertrandBadre//t.co/1XykkbPTFc

name: Bertrand Badré
text: .@BertrandBadre: we need to 1) make sure the international organisations are working well 2) build systems to channel money to the right projects 3) make sure the people on the ground are trained well. #LSEfinance

name: Bertrand Badré
text: .@BertrandBadre: Still today we don't really know what a bank is. Is it a utility? Is it a company distributing credit? Is it something different? Until we know, we won't be able to regulate them appropriately. #LSEfinance//t.co/xGmA29QhoY

name: Bertrand Badré
text: Can finance save the world? A tricky question Bertrand Badr and Gordon Brown tried to give an answer to at LSE #LSEfinance//t.co/hYWH6HwxfW

name: Bertrand Badré
text: .@BertrandBadre we are going in a bad direction, which comes mostly from the US: as a substitute for trust we are building compliance, which is basically about ticking the box. This paralyses the system and encourages people not to take risks. #LSEfinance

name: Bertrand Badré
text: .@BertrandBadre we have to move outside the mindset of playing everything safe. It will not prevent the next crisis and it is paralysing the brain. #LSEfinance

name: Bertrand Badré
text: .@BertrandBadre: If we are incapable of reforming the World Bank, the AIIB (Asian Infrastructure Investment Bank) is placed to replace it. #LSEfinance

name: Bertrand Badré
text: We need a new global financial arrangement. Unlike in the 1940s and the 1980s, it's not clear that the US will lead. There are competing ideas about how it should be structured. - @BertrandBadre #LSEfinance//t.co/EAgytXn05v
